page.title: 18Transport in Rural Areas
page.content: This predominantely rural area contains l.5 kilometres of unclassified and ll kilometres of Non Principal classified road, allocated an annual maintenance budget of Â£760 and Â£l240 per kilometre respectively. The traffic carried is mainly light commuter traffic with some heavier farm machinery and an increasing number of vehicles used by American Air Force personnel travelling between RAF Upwood and USAF Alconbury. For the greater length of this road the width is effectively single lane, being approximately 4.5 metres wide. Public transport within the area is poor, with a limited bus service picking up at the villages of Great and Little Raveley and Wistow. Private coaches ferry the children to nearby schools. There is no railway network, the nearest station being at Huntingdon.
